definitions: brought into being or made to happen in reality
understood or became aware of something previously unclear
examples: The realised profits exceeded their initial projections
Her realised dream of opening a bakery inspired others
His newly realised understanding of the problem changed everything
The realised truth about the situation shocked everyone

definitions: having or showing a sensible and practical idea of what can be achieved
representing things in a way that is accurate and true to life
examples: Setting realistic goals helps ensure success in any project
We need a realistic budget for this renovation
The artist's realistic portraits captured every detail perfectly
That movie had incredibly realistic special effects

definitions: brought into being or made to happen in reality
understood or became aware of something previously unclear
examples: The realized gains from the investment were substantial
Their realized vision transformed the entire community
She realized fears about the project were completely unfounded
His realized potential exceeded everyone's expectations

definitions: restored to life or consciousness after apparent death
given new vigor, enthusiasm, or liveliness to something
examples: The reanimated patient shocked the medical staff
Horror movies often feature reanimated corpses
The reanimated discussion brought fresh perspectives to the issue
Her reanimated interest in painting produced amazing artwork

definitions: situated at or toward the back of something
relating to the back part or hindquarters of an animal
examples: The rear entrance provides better access to parking
Please use the rear door during construction
The horse's rear legs showed signs of injury
The rear portion of the vehicle sustained damage

definitions: rising up on the hind legs or lifting the front part
engaged in bringing up and caring for offspring
examples: The rearing horse made an impressive sight
A rearing cobra is extremely dangerous
Their rearing practices emphasized independence and creativity
Modern rearing methods have changed significantly

definitions: situated at the very back or furthest point from the front
examples: The rearmost seats offer the best view of the screen
Supplies were stored in the rearmost compartment
The rearmost soldier kept watch for any followers
They occupied the rearmost position in the convoy

definitions: directed or moving toward the rear or back
located at or near the rear of something
examples: The rearward movement of troops signaled retreat
Make a rearward adjustment to improve balance
The rearward section houses the engine compartment
Rearward visibility is limited in this vehicle

definitions: having sound judgment and being fair and sensible
not too expensive or excessive in price or cost
moderate or acceptable in degree, amount, or quality
examples: She made a reasonable argument for changing the policy
His reasonable approach helped resolve the conflict
The restaurant offers reasonable prices for quality food
They charge reasonable fees for their services
We walked a reasonable distance before taking a break
There's a reasonable chance of rain tomorrow

definitions: based on or using logical thinking and careful consideration
examples: Her reasoned response convinced the skeptical board members
The judge delivered a carefully reasoned verdict
A reasoned debate requires listening to all perspectives
His reasoned approach to problem-solving impressed colleagues

definitions: engaged in the process of thinking about something in a logical way
examples: The reasoning mind distinguishes humans from other animals
Her reasoning skills helped solve the complex puzzle
A reasoning approach beats emotional reactions every time
The reasoning process requires patience and objectivity

definitions: feeling confident and free from anxiety after receiving comfort or encouragement
examples: The reassured patients felt ready for their procedures
Her reassured smile showed the talk had helped
Reassured investors began buying stocks again
The reassured child finally fell asleep peacefully

definitions: giving comfort or confidence by removing doubts or fears
examples: His reassuring words calmed the frightened children
The doctor's reassuring manner helped anxious patients
A reassuring presence during crisis makes all the difference
She gave a reassuring nod to her nervous colleague

definitions: showing a desire to resist authority, control, or convention
characterized by or showing defiance of established rules or norms
examples: The rebellious teenager constantly challenged school rules
Rebellious soldiers refused to follow orders
Her rebellious spirit led to innovative artistic breakthroughs
The rebellious attitude of youth often drives social change

definitions: brought back to life or given a new existence
experiencing spiritual renewal or transformation
examples: The reborn phoenix rose from its own ashes
She felt reborn after recovering from illness
His reborn faith gave him strength through hardship
The reborn congregation grew rapidly in membership

definitions: stubbornly refusing to obey rules or follow guidance; uncooperative
examples: The recalcitrant student refused to complete any assignments
Recalcitrant employees were given final warnings
A recalcitrant mule wouldn't budge despite all efforts
The recalcitrant computer system resisted all repair attempts

definitions: moving back or away from a previous position
gradually becoming smaller, weaker, or less noticeable
examples: The receding tide revealed hidden rock pools
His receding footsteps echoed down the corridor
A receding hairline made him look older
The receding memory of childhood grew fainter

definitions: capable of being received or accepted
awaiting receipt as payment owed by customers or debtors
examples: The signal is receivable within a fifty-mile radius
These documents are receivable as evidence
Accounts receivable represent money owed to the company
The receivable invoices totaled over a million dollars

definitions: accepted as authoritative or true by most people
having been given, obtained, or acquired from someone
examples: The received wisdom suggests eating breakfast is essential
Received pronunciation was once required for BBC announcers
The received packages were damaged during shipping
All received applications will be reviewed this week

definitions: having happened, begun, or been done not long ago or lately
examples: Recent events have changed our understanding completely
The most recent data shows improving trends
Her recent promotion came with increased responsibilities
Recent developments in technology amaze scientists daily

definitions: willing to consider or accept new suggestions and ideas
able or ready to receive sensory stimuli or signals
examples: The receptive audience embraced the innovative proposal
She's very receptive to constructive criticism
Receptive cells in the retina respond to light
The receptive field determines sensory processing

definitions: set back or indented from the surrounding surface or wall
examples: Recessed lighting creates a modern, clean appearance
The recessed doorway provided shelter from rain
A recessed handle maintains the cabinet's sleek profile
Recessed windows add architectural interest to buildings

definitions: relating to a gene that produces its effect only when two copies are present
tending to go back or recede; showing recession
examples: Blue eyes result from recessive genes from both parents
The recessive trait appeared in one quarter of offspring
The recessive economy worried financial analysts
Recessive gum disease requires immediate treatment

definitions: capable of being recharged with electricity for repeated use
examples: Rechargeable batteries save money and reduce waste
This rechargeable flashlight lasts for years
Most modern devices use rechargeable power sources
Rechargeable vehicles are becoming increasingly popular

definitions: given, felt, or done in return for something similar
bearing a mutual relationship; corresponding but inverse
examples: Their reciprocal respect strengthened the partnership
Reciprocal trade agreements benefit both countries
The reciprocal relationship between predator and prey maintains balance
Reciprocal functions have important mathematical properties

definitions: acting without thinking or caring about consequences; dangerously careless
examples: His reckless driving endangered everyone on the road
Reckless spending led to their financial ruin
The reckless decision cost the company millions
She made reckless promises she couldn't keep

definitions: brought back into use from waste or abandonment
reformed from an immoral or debased condition
examples: Reclaimed wood gives furniture unique character and history
The reclaimed land became a thriving nature reserve
The reclaimed criminal became a community advocate
A reclaimed life deserves society's support

definitions: avoiding the company of other people; living in solitude
examples: The recluse millionaire rarely left his estate
A recluse lifestyle appealed to the writer
Recluse spiders hide in dark, undisturbed places
The recluse monk devoted himself to meditation

definitions: avoiding the company of other people; seeking solitude and privacy
examples: The reclusive author hadn't given interviews in decades
His reclusive nature made friendships difficult
A reclusive lifestyle can impact mental health
The reclusive celebrity avoided all public appearances

definitions: able to be recognized or identified from previous encounters or knowledge
examples: Her voice was instantly recognisable on the phone
The building's recognisable silhouette dominates the skyline
Barely recognisable symptoms delayed the diagnosis
His recognisable style influenced many artists

definitions: officially acknowledged as valid or legitimate
identified as something or someone previously known
examples: She's a recognised expert in marine biology
The recognised qualifications ensure professional standards
His recognised talent earned multiple awards
The recognised symptoms led to quick diagnosis

definitions: able to be recognized or identified from previous encounters or knowledge
examples: The actor remained recognizable despite heavy makeup
A recognizable brand builds customer loyalty
The barely recognizable voice came through static
Her recognizable laugh filled the room

definitions: officially acknowledged as valid or legitimate
identified as something or someone previously known
examples: He's a recognized leader in renewable energy
The recognized procedure must be followed exactly
Her recognized contributions earned a Nobel Prize
The recognized pattern helped solve the case

definitions: made consistent or compatible despite apparent differences
restored to friendship or harmony after disagreement
examples: The reconciled accounts showed no discrepancies
Reconciled data from different sources proved reliable
The reconciled couple renewed their wedding vows
Reconciled enemies became strongest allies

definitions: bringing into agreement or harmony; making compatible
examples: Her reconciling approach helped merge the departments
The reconciling process took several months
A reconciling attitude helps resolve conflicts peacefully
Reconciling differences requires patience and understanding

definitions: built again after being damaged or destroyed; recreated from evidence
examples: The reconstructed building maintains its historical character
Reconstructed DNA revealed evolutionary relationships
A reconstructed timeline clarified the sequence of events
The reconstructed face helped identify the victim

definitions: relating to surgical procedures that restore form or function to body parts
examples: Reconstructive surgery helped accident victims regain normalcy
The reconstructive procedure required multiple operations
A reconstructive approach to history challenges assumptions
Reconstructive techniques advance medical possibilities

definitions: set down in writing or other permanent form for later reference
captured on audio, video, or other electronic medium
examples: The recorded history spans over three thousand years
All recorded complaints receive official responses
Their recorded album topped the charts for weeks
The recorded conversation provided crucial evidence

definitions: able to be regained, retrieved, or restored after loss or damage
examples: The recoverable data gave hope after the crash
Most deleted files remain recoverable for some time
Recoverable costs will be reimbursed by insurance
The recoverable resources justify the investment

definitions: returned to normal health from illness or injury
obtained again after loss; retrieved or reclaimed
examples: The recovered patient left hospital yesterday
A recovered addict now counsels others
The recovered artwork was returned to the museum
Recovered memories sparked controversy among psychologists

definitions: in the process of returning to normal health after illness or addiction
examples: The recovering patient needs continued rest and care
A recovering alcoholic requires ongoing support
The recovering economy shows promising growth signs
Recovering athletes must follow strict rehabilitation protocols

definitions: relating to or denoting activities done for enjoyment during leisure time
examples: The park offers various recreational facilities for families
Recreational fishing requires a special license
Her recreational reading includes mystery novels
Recreational sports promote health and social interaction

definitions: relating to, affecting, or located near the rectum
examples: The rectal examination revealed no abnormalities
Rectal bleeding requires immediate medical attention
A rectal thermometer provides accurate temperature readings
Rectal cancer screening saves many lives annually

definitions: having the shape of a rectangle with four right angles
examples: The rectangular table seats eight people comfortably
A rectangular pool fits better in narrow yards
Rectangular coordinates simplify many mathematical calculations
The rectangular frame enhanced the portrait perfectly

definitions: put right; corrected or repaired something that was wrong
examples: The rectified error prevented further complications
A rectified situation restored customer confidence
The rectified current flows in one direction only
Rectified spirits contain highly concentrated alcohol

definitions: lying down in a position of rest or comfort; reclining
examples: The recumbent figure in the painting appeared peaceful
A recumbent position helps reduce back pressure
Recumbent bicycles offer comfortable long-distance riding
The recumbent patient needed assistance sitting up

definitions: occurring often or repeatedly over time; happening again
examples: Her recurrent nightmares disrupted sleep for months
The recurrent theme appears throughout his novels
Recurrent infections may indicate underlying health issues
A recurrent problem requires systematic solution

definitions: occurring again periodically or repeatedly over time
examples: The recurring payment processes automatically each month
A recurring dream haunted him for years
Recurring revenue provides business stability
The recurring character became fan favorite

definitions: able to be processed and used again to make new products
examples: Most plastic bottles are recyclable if properly cleaned
Recyclable materials should be sorted from regular trash
The company uses only recyclable packaging materials
Recyclable products help reduce environmental impact

definitions: of a color at the end of the spectrum next to orange
supporting radical left-wing political views, especially communism
showing embarrassment, anger, or physical exertion through facial flushing
examples: The red roses symbolized passionate love
A red sunset painted the evening sky
The red faction advocated for revolutionary change
Red states historically supported socialist policies
His red face revealed his embarrassment
She turned red with fury at the insult
